title: Harsh Sentence for Putin Critic Highlights Kremlin’s Repression
description: A Moscow court sentenced Vladimir Kara-Murza to 25 years in prison, making it clear that any criticism of the war can lead to prison time.

title: Tracking the Chemicals in the East Palestine, Ohio, Train Derailment and Fire
description: Tankers of vinyl chloride were going halfway across the country, government records show, a trip highlighting the risks of transporting chemicals as plastics production grows.

title: Seeking to Calm Unrest, Macron Calls for a ‘New Pact of Life and Work’
description: But the French president did not yield on the pension change that has roiled the nation. Labor unions declined to meet for talks, and vowed massive protests on May 1.

title: Hospitals and Aid Groups Become Targets as Sudan Fighting Intensifies
description: Civilians are caught in the cross-fire, and two rival generals vying for power made it clear their forces had no intention of standing down.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: A Long Sentence for a Putin Critic
description: Also, fighting roils Sudan’s capital.

title: After American’s Killing in Syria, F.B.I. Builds War Crimes Case Against Top Officials
description: The inquiry aims to hold to account Syrian officials considered key architects of a brutal system of detention and torture that flourished under President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Axel Springer C.E.O. Apologizes for Remarks
description: Texts by Mathias Döpfner, the chief executive of the German media giant, included a request urging favorable coverage of a political party. They were published by a rival publication.

title: Chinese Worker in Pakistan Is Arrested on Blasphemy Charges
description: The arrest of a foreigner under the country’s harsh blasphemy laws, which can lead to the death penalty, is rare and could strain an otherwise warming relationship between China and Pakistan.

title: Who Is Vladimir Kara-Murza, Russian Opposition Activist?
description: Vladimir Kara-Murza was sentenced on Monday to 25 years in a Russian penal colony.

title: Sudan Live Updates: Civilians Feel Strain as Blasts Rock Capital
description: Many Khartoum residents were trapped at home without electricity or water as the country’s two top generals battled for a third day to control the East African nation.

title: Evan Gershkovich, WSJ Reporter Detained in Russia, Has First Consular Visit
description: Mr. Gershkovich, 31, was arrested by Russian security services in late March and formally charged with espionage, an accusation that his employer and U.S. officials vehemently deny.

title: New Wave of Fighting Hits Sudan’s Capital
description: Khartoum residents were trapped at home without electricity or water as the country’s two top generals battled for a third day to control the East African nation.

title: Diplomacy, aid and a court hearing for Evan Gershkovich: What to watch for this week.
Airbus and Air France Acquitted Over 2009 Rio-Paris Crash
description: Prosecutors had said they would not seek a conviction in the disaster, but the ruling was still a blow for the families of the 228 victims, who fought for years to bring the two companies to court.

title: Fox News on Trial
description: A lawsuit against Fox News could help decide the boundaries of press freedom.

title: Kremlin Critic Convicted of Treason for Criticizing Putin’s Invasion
description: A court in Moscow sentenced Vladimir Kara-Murza after he gave speeches opposing Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: Battles for Control of Sudan Stretch Into a Third Day
description: Nearly 100 people were killed over the weekend in fighting between the army and paramilitary forces as the country’s two top generals vied for dominance.

title: In Photos: Families of Guatemalans Killed in Migrant Center Fire Bury Their Dead
description: The fire in March left 40 people dead.

title: Peering Into Volcanoes at Tanzania’s Crater Highlands
description: Uninterested in the extreme altitudes of Kilimanjaro, a writer opted instead to explore the region’s vast calderas, abundant wildlife and rare forms of lava.

title: With Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine, NATO Readies for Combat on Its Borders
description: Shocked by Russian atrocities, NATO is becoming the war-fighting alliance it was during the Cold War, committed to defending “every inch” of its territory from Day 1.

title: In Pakistan, Economic Crisis Mutes Ramadan Celebrations
description: Rampant inflation, damaged crops and the war in Ukraine have sent food prices soaring during the Muslim holy month of daytime fasting and nighttime feasting.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Chaotic fighting in Sudan.
